Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I used NEAT to fit my training data.
The fitness function is minus MSE, lik=
e fitness =3D -mse.
Hopefully the mse of the champion will become smaller i=
n each upcoming
generation, which means it fits the traing data better.
I u=
sed the MATLAB vertion, and the parameters is the same as the
original sett=
ing.
The result seems quite confusing, for the -mse value increases in the
=
beginning 20 generation, and it descrases then.
The draft below shows the a=
pproximate result, the horizontal axis is the
generation, and the vertical =
axis is the minus MSE.
|
|                               *
|               =
         *                *
|                     *                        =
   *
|                 *                                    *
|            =
  *                                           *
|           *              =
                                     *
|         *
|        *              =
                                               
*
|       *
*
|      *
*
| =
    *
*
|     *
|    *
|   *
| *
|
|_______________________________________=
__________________________

The results is averaged over about 30 runs, in =
each single run, the
trend is similar, it increases in the beginning and de=
creases after
about 20 to 30 generation.
However, I expected the minus MSE =
should be increase along with the
generation increases.
Can anyone give me =
any hints about this pheomenon?
Thank you very much.
